smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain valid model elements; no empty diagrams were found.
On the Use Case diagram (Page 2), the use case 'Tuvasta kasutaja' is visually isolated and not associated with any actor or connected to other use cases via include/extend relationships.
No actors were found associated with multiple use cases that describe the same activity using synonyms.
No packages were found containing multiple model elements with identical names.
No redundant data storage (denormalization) without foreign keys was identified in the database schemas.
Use case naming appears consistent, predominantly using the 'Verb Noun' structure (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid') in Estonian.
In the state diagram (Page 7), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, etc.) are reachable from the initial state.
In the activity diagram (Page 3), all actions are part of the connected flow and are reachable from the start node.
Relationships in class and database diagrams generally display necessary multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*) where appropriate.

The Use Case diagram on Page 2 contains 11 central use case elements (ovals). Additionally, the Class diagram on Page 6 contains 11 central class elements (Klassifikaator and its subclasses). This exceeds the threshold of 10.

On Page 6, the class 'Klassifikaator' has 10 visual inheritance connections pointing to it. On Page 14, the table 'Auto' has visual connections to 6 other tables (Auto_kategooria_omamine, Auto_kytuse_liik, Auto_seisundi_liik, Auto_mark, and two distinct connections to Tootaja).
No elements were found positioned at a distance greater than twice the average distance relative to related elements.
All use cases and activity actions start with active verbs (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Otsi', 'Registreeri').
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found to be 3 characters or less (standard abbreviations like 'id' are exceptions or part of valid keys).
Class names are capitalized and singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Riik').
Attribute and column names start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'nimetus').
No invalid Hungarian notation or type prefixes were found in element names. Standard key prefixes (PK_, FK_) are allowed.
